+// --------------------------------------------------------------------------
+
+REGISTER_OP("Cumsum")
+    .Input("x: T")
+    .Input("axis: int32")
+    .Attr("reverse: bool")
+    .Output("out: T")
+    .Attr("T: numbertype")
+    .Doc(R"doc(
+Compute the cumulative sum of the tensor `x` along `axis`.
+
+The output `out` at any given index i is equal to the sum of all
+elements `x_j` of `x` with j <= i.
+
+By setting the `reverse` operation to `True`, the sum is performed in the
+reverse order. In contrast to using `tf.reverse`, this avoids copying the
+tensor.
body:
I've though about this when writing the op.
I'm not sure how to neatly make the exclusive version accessible in Eigen, except by creating a new `cumsum_exclusive(...)` method.
Maybe it's enough to only add this on the TensorFlow side by optionally padding the tensor with the value that we get from `Reducer::initialize()` ?
